Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2007 02:25AM trisha38 wrote: I was told that cancer is graded on a range from 0 to 9 on how aggressive the tumor was.mine was a nine.My surgeon told me that my hormone tests were negative,and that i would not benefit from hormone therpy.Thanks for answering so quickly.The surgeon says that what makes mine a stage 1 was the size of the tumor.I have my first appointment with my oncologist on November 19th.How long does it usually take for chemo to start after the first initally oncology visit?
Posts.Title: October 2007 Chemo Girls 3boys4me saucybee

Posts.Content: Nov 8, 2007 01:36AM trisha38 wrote: I'm a new member here.I'm 38 and  a mother of 3 (20,17,7).I had a lumpectomy.the tumor was 1.1 cm.I had a sintennial node biopsy (no node involement, 3 where checked).Thank God!!,But the tumor was a nine,grade III,stageI.Going into surgery i thought i was just looking at a lumpectomy w/radiation therpy,but my sugeon says that he wouldn't be surprised if my oncologist recommends chemo based on the fact that i am so young to have breast cancer and because it was a 9...was not expecting that.I thought The surgery would be the hard part..looks like a long road a head.Chemo scares me..How many months does chemo last??? What are the most common side affect and why ports instead of IV?? what decides that factor? Let me just say while im here a self breast exam saved my life.If i wasn't doing them it would have taken 2 yrs. brfore it would have been caught with a mammogram.I'll take any advice that i can get.                                  thanks, Trisha
